citations.narrative:
The back enclosure housing the 2 African Crested Porcupine and the enclosure housing the 2 Kinkajou are approximately
2 feet from the perimeter fence. The perimeter fence must be of sufficient distance from the outside of the primary
enclosure to prevent physical contact between animals inside the enclosure and animals or persons outside the perimeter
fence. An individual could reach 2 feet across the perimeter fence and access the animal enclosures. Such fences less
than 3 feet in distance from the primary enclosure must be approved in writing by the Administrator. The enclosures must
be located at least 3 feet from the perimeter fence to prevent contact with the animals..
This is a 1st Re-License Inspection for a Class “C” license. The inspection and exit briefing were conducted with the
applicant.
All items must be in compliance within 1 more inspection or by 10/15/2023 or the applicant will forfeit the license fee and
must wait 6 months to reapply. Please contact your inspector to schedule your next Re-License Inspection.
Regulated activity can continue under your existing USDA license until it expires but there must be no regulated activity
with the bat eared foxes until the facility is in compliance.
n

narrative:
3.127(d) 
   
Facilities, outdoor. 
The back enclosure housing the 2 African Crested Porcupine and the enclosure housing the 2 Kinkajou are approximately 
2 feet from the perimeter fence. The perimeter fence must be of sufficient distance from the outside of the primary 
enclosure to prevent physical contact between animals inside the enclosure and animals or persons outside the perimeter 
fence. An individual could reach 2 feet across the perimeter fence and access the animal enclosures. Such fences less 
than 3 feet in distance from the primary enclosure must be approved in writing by the Administrator. The enclosures must 
be located at least 3 feet from the perimeter fence to prevent contact with the animals.. 
 
This is a 1st Re-License Inspection for a Class “C” license. The inspection and exit briefing were conducted with the 
applicant. 
 
All items must be in compliance within 1 more inspection or by 10/15/2023 or the applicant will forfeit the license fee and 
must wait 6 months to reapply. Please contact your inspector to schedule your next Re-License Inspection. 
 
Regulated activity can continue under your existing USDA license until it expires but there must be no regulated activity 
with the bat eared foxes until the facility is in compliance. 
 
 n
